value.name: CANT USE
value.tooltip: Set me.

bit.name: cortana hack
bit.tooltip: Sort cortana in front of other transparent geometry.

bit.name: use demo UI
bit.tooltip: Uses alternate UI collection for demo.

bit.name: scripted
bit.tooltip: The level script will set this value; the other settings here will be ignored..

bit.name: invert
bit.tooltip: Result of function is one minus actual result.

bit.name: always active
bit.tooltip: Function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound.

value.name: period
value.tooltip: This is the period for the above function (lower values make the function oscillate quickly, higher values make it oscillate slowly).

value.name: scale period by
value.tooltip: Multiply this function by the above period.

value.name: scale function by
value.tooltip: Multiply this function by the result of the above function.

value.name: wobble function
value.tooltip: The curve used for the wobble.

value.name: wobble period
value.tooltip: The length of time it takes for the magnitude of this function to complete a wobble.

value.name: wobble magnitude
value.tooltip: The amount of random wobble in the magnitude.

value.name: square wave threshold
value.tooltip: If non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave..

value.name: step count
value.tooltip: The number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00).

value.name: sawtooth count
value.tooltip: The number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0.

value.name: scale result by
value.tooltip: Multiply this function (from a weapon, vehicle, etc.) final result of all of the above math.

value.name: bounds mode
value.tooltip: Controls how the bounds, below, are used.

value.name: turn off with
value.tooltip: If the specified function is off, so is this function.

value.name: desired permutation
value.tooltip: If non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7".

value.name: desired permutation
value.tooltip: If non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7".

value.name: desired permutation
value.tooltip: If non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7".

value.name: multiplayer team index
value.tooltip: On a multiplayer map, this determines which team the vehicle belongs to for custom vehicle sets..

bit.name: slayer default
bit.tooltip: Vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a slayer game.

bit.name: ctf default
bit.tooltip: Vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a ctf game.

bit.name: king default
bit.tooltip: Vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a king game.

bit.name: oddball default
bit.tooltip: Vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a oddball game.

bit.name: unused
bit.tooltip: Unused.

bit.name: unused
bit.tooltip: Unused.

bit.name: unused
bit.tooltip: Unused.

bit.name: unused
bit.tooltip: Unused.

bit.name: slayer allowed
bit.tooltip: Vehicle can spawn in a slayer game.

bit.name: ctf allowed
bit.tooltip: Vehicle can spawn in a ctf game.

bit.name: king allowed
bit.tooltip: Vehicle can spawn in a king game.

bit.name: oddball allowed
bit.tooltip: Vehicle can spawn in a oddball game.

bit.name: unused
bit.tooltip: Unused.

bit.name: unused
bit.tooltip: Unused.

bit.name: unused
bit.tooltip: Unused.

bit.name: unused
bit.tooltip: Unused.

value.name: desired permutation
value.tooltip: If non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7".

bit.name: does accelerate moves due to explosions

value.name: desired permutation
value.tooltip: If non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7".

bit.name: does accelerate moves due to explosions

value.name: desired permutation
value.tooltip: If non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7".

value.name: desired permutation
value.tooltip: If non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7".

value.name: desired permutation
value.tooltip: If non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7".

value.name: desired permutation
value.tooltip: If non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7".

value.name: manual bsp index
value.tooltip: Structure bsp index that this encounter belongs to... ignored unless 'manual bsp index' flag is checked. if this flag is not checked, the structure bsp is found automatically (may fail in areas of overlapping geometry).

value.name: respawn delay
value.tooltip: Delay between respawning actors in this encounter.

value.name: initial state
value.tooltip: State that this actor starts in.

value.name: return state
value.tooltip: State that this actor will return to when it has nothing to do.

value.name: unique leader type
value.tooltip: What kind of leader this squad has (e.g. a sarge for marines) - 'normal' is based on the size of the squad, 'random' always creates a leader, or you can specify an individual type.

value.name: normal diff count
value.tooltip: Initial number of actors on normal difficulty.

value.name: insane diff count
value.tooltip: Initial number of actors on insane difficulty (hard difficulty is midway between normal and insane).

value.name: respawn min actors
value.tooltip: Minimum number of actors alive at once (will spawn instantly if less than this number).

value.name: respawn max actors
value.tooltip: Maximum number of actors alive at once (never spawns above this number).

value.name: respawn total
value.tooltip: Total number to respawn (zero = infinite).

value.name: respawn delay
value.tooltip: Delay between respawning actors in this squad.

value.name: sequence ID
value.tooltip: Identifies this move position as belonging to a sequence, only actors whose starting locations match this sequence ID can use it (zero = no sequence).

value.name: sequence ID
value.tooltip: Which move position sequence we can use (zero = no specific sequences).

value.name: return state
value.tooltip: State that this actor will return to when it has nothing to do.

value.name: initial state
value.tooltip: State that this actor starts in.

bit.name: allow initiative
bit.tooltip: Lets an actor decide to stop following its commands and attack an enemy.

bit.name: allow targeting
bit.tooltip: Lets an actor shoot at enemies while following its commands.

bit.name: disable looking
bit.tooltip: Stops an actor from turning, stopping or looking around in response to stimuli received while following its commands.

bit.name: disable communication
bit.tooltip: Stops an actor from communicating while following its commands.

bit.name: disable falling damage
bit.tooltip: Makes an actor not take any damage from falling while following its commands.

bit.name: manual bsp index
bit.tooltip: Set if the command list is manually attached to a specific bsp.

value.name: manual bsp index
value.tooltip: Structure bsp index that this encounter belongs to... ignored unless 'manual bsp index' flag is checked. if this flag is not checked, the structure bsp is found automatically (may fail in areas of overlapping geometry).

value.name: animation graph
value.tooltip: Leave this blank to use the unit's normal animation graph.

bit.name: stop if death
bit.tooltip: This conversation will be aborted if any participant dies.

bit.name: stop if damaged
bit.tooltip: An actor will abort this conversation if they are damaged.

bit.name: stop if visible enemy
bit.tooltip: An actor will abort this conversation if they see an enemy.

bit.name: stop if alerted to enemy
bit.tooltip: An actor will abort this conversation if they suspect an enemy.

bit.name: player must be visible
bit.tooltip: This conversation cannot take place unless the participants can _see_ a nearby player.

bit.name: stop other actions
bit.tooltip: Participants stop doing whatever they were doing in order to perform this conversation.

bit.name: keep trying to play
bit.tooltip: If this conversation fails initially, it will keep testing to see when it can play.

bit.name: player must be looking
bit.tooltip: This conversation will not start until the player is looking at one of the participants.

value.name: trigger distance
value.tooltip: Distance the player must enter before the conversation can trigger.

value.name: ru
value.tooltip: If the 'involves player' flag is set, when triggered the conversation's participant(s) will run to within this distance of the player.

bit.name: optional
bit.tooltip: The conversation can continue even if nobody for this participant was found.

bit.name: has alternate
bit.tooltip: If nobody for this participant can be found, we use a participant marked as 'is alternate' instead, e.g. someone from over the radio.

bit.name: is alternate
bit.tooltip: This participant is only used if some participant in this conversation was marked as 'has alternate' could not be found.

value.name: use this object
value.tooltip: If a unit with this name exists, we try to pick them to start the conversation.

value.name: set new name
value.tooltip: Once we pick a unit, we name it this.

bit.name: wait after until told to advance

value.name: addressee participant
value.tooltip: This field is only used if the addressee type is 'participant'.
